p: Climate change was expected to result in wetter soils with lower O 2 relative to PC in all three STAs. Water-filled pore space (WFPS) increased under CC for conventional and shallow narrow STAs at all depths ( Fig 2). Values of WFPS for P&S ranged from 3%-11% under PC and increased to 10%-47% under CC, whereas WFPS increased from 5%-23% to 16%-29% in the shallow narrow STAs under CC. The concentration of O 2 in soil pores was lower under CC relative to PC at all depths ( Fig 3). Less O 2 and higher WFPS in the STA can have a number of consequences for contaminant removal processes, discussed below.
